body: I don't think having a `prefix` arugment is necessary. It will end up calling the module like "prefix.9", which doesn't really help. It's not a valid identifier in Python, and we usually use dots to denote that there's a module called "prefix" and it has a submodule named "9" (so it's a nested module structure). I'd rather remove it from this diff.
